summary: Email correspondence between the court and counsel regarding the sealing request for the joint proposed juror questionnaire and voir dire in the US v. Maxwell case, with mention of Jencks Act material production.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The Honorable Judge presiding over the US v. Maxwell case, whose chambers sent instructions regarding sealing requests and requested a copy of Jencks Act material.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: Appears as part of the email address 'Nathan NYSD Chambers', representing the chambers of Judge Alison J. Nathan.

connections.description: Nathan is part of Judge Nathan's chambers staff, handling court correspondence.

events.title: Sealing Request for Juror Materials
events.description: The parties in US v. Maxwell jointly request the court to accept the proposed juror questionnaire and voir dire under seal, with the court providing instructions on the sealing request procedure.

events.title: Production of Jencks Act Material
events.description: The Government produced Jencks Act material and exhibits to the defense, as mentioned in the correspondence.

keyFacts: The document is email correspondence regarding procedural matters in the US v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330) case before Judge Alison J. Nathan.
The parties jointly requested the court to accept the proposed juror questionnaire and voir dire under seal.
The Government produced Jencks Act material and exhibits to the defense on or around October 11, 2021.
The court instructed that any request for sealing must be docketed on ECF unless justification for filing under seal is provided.
